title: So, Soraka can't break meta anymore?
body:
No more Raka mid or even top? Must she be pigeonholed into support only? My friend had a lot of fun playing soraka as a jungler. Many supports can successfully solo lane and do well, why can't Soraka anymore?

Not only that, she is the only support who cannot defend herself, Sona, Janna, Lulu, Braum , etc all have something to defend themselves with and run away, but raka has slow base movement speed and no escapes or reliable cc.

Maybe it's just me, what do you guys think?

Then why was her AA damage nerfed?  The only thing that did was reduce her poke capabilities and make people who played AD Soraka QQ.  Riot says that they're only nerfing for said reasons, but a lot of extra nerfs come packaged in that nobody wanted, needed, or asked for.

If you're playing AD Soraka, you're playing non-meta right? The most fun thing about being non-meta is making the 'unviable' work with the use of sheer skill (unless you're just a troll). That being said, for the meta heads, there's no reason for a support, especially one that doesn't scream 'I should auto attack' to have AD so high that it competes with some of the great bruisers and damage dealers in the game, healer and high AD don't even go together thematically... As for the non-meta thinkers... Having high AD just makes it too easy. :p

No, the most fun thing about breaking the meta is using an unorthodox build that is viable to crush your opponents by building and playing unpredictably.  AP MF is a stellar example of this.  When facing MF, people expect her Q and AAs to hurt like a mother, not her E and ultimate.  What made AD Soraka fun was the fact that you had a huge leg up in terms of AA damage, but your DPS scaling was terrible, and building her AD meant no sustain.  After her rework, her AD build actually became more viable due to her Q's innate sustain, and allowed you to hilariously zone, bully, and AA your opponents to death.

As for support Soraka, because Soraka's peeling capabilities are lackluster compared to most supports, she made up for it by having some scary zoning and poking capabilities with beefy autoattacks and huge AOE.  Taking away the AA damage means less poke.  So your arguments are completely invalid.
This was intentional because as always, morello hates soraka.

For some champions, {{champion:16}} among them, the choice comes to this: would you rather have champion X be able to thrive in multiple different lanes and/or the jungle, or would you rather they be the best they can be at their primary role? Soraka has a clear set of strengths and weaknesses, and all of them hinge on her allies: she's the best healer in the game, and can keep allies topped up even against heavy burst or sustained damage, but also puts herself at heavy risk and dies quickly to focus. Her weakness to hard engages is what makes her killable in teamfights, and what allows her to have the phenomenal healing and supporting power she has. Toning this power down just to make her a better solo lane pick makes little sense, just as it doesn't make much sense to make the game's most selfless champion a competent solo laner when most of her abilities are geared towards helping her team.

It's also worth noting that the only reason Soraka was (briefly) a viable solo laner is because of how abusive she was. Her old Q let her zone out the enemy laner practically for free, and her long-duration, point-and-click E silence gave her free and oppressive harass, particularly against casters. Focusing her didn't work well either, because she frequently built like a bruiser and could make herself super-tanky with the armor on her old W. She was viable in solo lane for all the wrong reasons, and that solo lane power ended up costing her a lot of her supporting strength, prior to her rework.
Based on the number of fans she had top/mid before she became OP, I think riot should have kept her as a multirole champ and created a new primary healer that went full ret*rd in healing.

Considering Soraka was, and still is, the only champion in the game with two ally-oriented heals (and one of them's a global ult), I don't think it would have made sense for anyone else but her to be the game's best healer. Healing is what she has always been best known for, so if it would really be worth having a solo lane caster with strong healing power, I think that would have to go to another champion (though {{champion:37}} sort of fits the bill, what with her multi-target healing power, great poke and generous AP scalings).
Except her heal was on a long CD before and wasn't spammable.  What riot should have done was create a new champ based around soraka's new W instead of trying to work soraka around it.

That's more of a technicality, though: Soraka's old heal had a long cooldown because it had no real cost (Soraka could easily manage it even when it cost 160 mana a pop), and in general its gameplay was never really that interesting. Riot tried to shoehorn a bit of clutch-saving power with her old Salvation passive (heal more on low-health targets) and the short-duration armor buff her heal gave, but in the end it still made her really passive as a support and muddied the counterplay against her (she's meant to be fragile and vulnerable on her own, but that wasn't always the case when she could heal and armor up on demand). Soraka's new W is what her old W should have been right from the start, and I'm happy for the massive power and gameplay it provides.

I also feel Soraka's kit was always worked around her heal(s). Prior to her rework, her Q got an increasingly large amount of power shifted into her heal by reducing her W's cooldown upon damaging enemy champions, and she had less CC and alternate utility than other supports just because healing took up so much of her power budget. Her old Q also made very little sense, as it forced her to get up close to her enemies for extended periods of time as a (theoretically) squishy caster support. Looking at her kit now, it just looks like the kind of power Soraka should have been about from the very beginning, whereas her brief stint as a mid-range bruiser mage never really fit her, her theme or her gameplay.
I think her old hit revolved around her E and her new one around her Q.

A healer can really never be allowed to be able to solo lane.  Supports in general can't really be allowed to solo lane.  Supports are balanced around being relevant without needing a ton of gold and being able to solo lane gives them vastly more gold than they usually have which completely puts them over the top.  You can look at solo lane Lulu and Season 2 Janna for reference.

> Not only that, she is the only support who cannot defend herself, Sona, Janna, Lulu, Braum , etc all have something to defend themselves with and run away, but raka has slow base movement speed and no escapes or reliable cc.
> 

Well thats just not true. Soraka can beat most of the supports that are not damage focused 1v1, since in a battle where both sides have low damage, the constant slow from Q + selfheal wins. (I am assuming that you put a few points in Q first, since i think thats most reasonable if you want to be usefull)

You can escape with Q+E (btw you should never throw away your E as single spell unless you absolutely have to or just want to stop a channeled spell always chain it with your Q or allied spells) and you then cast out of range Q's that your pursuers run into. There are very few champions that have enough mobility to catch up with that. Despite her slow base movement speed Soraka is actually very good at kiting.

So even the enemies with the highest damage would slowly die if you play correctly. Soraka doesn't have a lot of potential to chase down kills herself, but if she is getting chased she can deal quite a lot of damage while being relatively safe.

About breaking the meta, there are some very easy match ups, especially melee assassins or more squishy melee fighters like Riven.
 But Sorakas main weaknesses are :

* her lack of abilities to get cs under tower,
* her low AD coupled with extremely slow traveling bananas make last hitting very hard 

You can't consistently carry many games with a "mage approach", you often

*  have to transition into some kind of support to be efficient and thats kinda tricky to be support while being assigned to a solo lane.

If you are constantly getting pushed in you would

*  rely on your team to have any chance of breaking out and having a chance to make an impact.

Other champions get tons of damage as the game progresses and become a lot more threating to you and you simply cannot face them anymore at some point. The heal over time from Q that was strong in laning phase just wont be enough anymore so you would end up ulting in an attempt to 1v1 somebody and that on its own is a waste and probably won't be enough either.

I don't even care that Soraka isn't truly viable as support, I think it's totally OK that she is pure support. However many players don't know how to handle a solo lane Soraka, so you kinda have the surprise effect on your side should you play it.

At any rate you might be right that she is sub-optimal as solo laner but definitely not for the reasons you mentioned at first.
Your options are winning early or becoming a strong support or both. ;D
Carrying late game with Starcalls is unlikey to happen....very.

So long...

Starcall can do a lot of damage if building AP, and will also slow the target if you land it to the center of your enemy.  Equinox not only silences, but if timed right, and if you lead the target correctly, it will stun them as well giving you an escape. I wouldn't play her in any other lane than support, but I can't see why she couldn't hold her own against a mid laner if you played safely. A few successful ganks may be in order, but over all she's still pretty powerful IMHO. {{champion:16}}
